metadata.name: Volatile statum essendi [06]
metadata.description:
Volatile statum essendi [volatile state of being]

 “A picture of my existence... would show a useless wooden stake covered in snow... stuck loosely at a slant in the ground in a ploughed field on the edge of a vast open plain on a dark winter night.” ― from Metamorphosis (Franz Kafka).

This chemigram intends to define and portray a vision of the volatility of the human condition. It was painted with darkroom chemicals on photographic paper, a process that is itself volatile. 

In addition, the collector will receive a high resolution and digitally calibrated scanned image [600dpi]. For more information, please, contact me on my Twitter handle.
